This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.etsy.com/uk/listing/647327604/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.etsy.com%2Fuk%2Flisting%2F647327604%2F) ### Comment > Site won't load, leaves a blank white screen with '429 Too Many Requests'. I had this with numerous Etsy links I had saved with AdGuard turned on on Mac O/S 12.6.4 (21G526) > I don't have a GitHub account. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/iYL9YdD.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/0iTb2Tz.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.10.0.1272+release Browser: | Firefox Stealth mode options: | Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header,
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Block third-party Authorization header,
Self-destructing first-party cookies (10),
Self-destructing third-party cookies (0),
Disable cache for third-party requests,
Block WebRTC,
Block Push API,
Block Location API,
Block Java,
Hide your IP address (208.54.104.184) DNS filtering: | server: `https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query`
filters: `AdGurad DNS` Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social Widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Annoyances

Language-specific:
AdGuard German,
AdGuard Japanese,
EasyList Italy,
Liste AR Userscripts: | I don't know. Your questions assume a lot of tech knowledge. Link below was in here aleeady so I just left it. Web+of+Trust+(url:+https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/adguard-wot/1.0/wot.user.js),
AdGuard+Popup+Blocker+(url:+https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/popup-blocker/2.5/popupblocker.user.js),
AdGuard+Assistant+(url:+https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/assistant/4.3/assistant.user.js),
AdGuard+Extra+(url:+https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js) Other extensions used: | Don't track me Google, Google Container, Protect My Choices, Privacy Possum, Duck Duck Go, Facebook Container, Firefox Multi Account Containers, Malwarebytes Browser Guard, Bit Defender Traffic Light. I turned them all OFF and tested again from new link, but still had the same issue. It's only on Mac though, same link works fine on iOS.

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.etsy.com/search?q=photo+frame&ref=search_bar](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.etsy.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Dphoto%2Bframe%26ref%3Dsearch_bar) ### Comment Username: @kittymmeow > With the AdGuard Base filter list enabled on the search page on Etsy, everything is blocked EXCEPT the ads. Ads on Etsy are listed with "Ad by Etsy seller", and with the filter list those are the only products that appear in search with everything else blocked. First screenshot is with all my listed filters and extensions enabled, 2nd screenshot the only change is that the AdGuard Base filter list has been disabled from uBlockOrigin, all other lists still enabled. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Add your comment and screenshots

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- ![247cd8ae0fee47b351503b1307b69859](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13221942/234424044-e53febf0-87f4-4177-853a-8f509eee32fa.jpg) -->

comment.body:
This rule seems to works fine on my end:
```adblock
etsy.com#?#div[data-search-results] .wt-list-unstyled .wt-text-caption > span[class]:contains(/Ad[\s\S].*by Etsy seller/):matches-css(display: inline-block):upward(.wt-list-unstyled)
```
but I'm not sure if it should be added - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/148111#issuecomment-1513134079
@Alex-302 Could you please take a look?

### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

v3.6.11 (54-1.10.186cl)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

https://news.google.com/articles/CBMiiwFodHRwczovL3d3dy5keW5hbW9tYW5pYS5jb20vcnUvbmV3cy82Nzg5NjUtaXNrdXNzdHZlbm55ai1pbnRlbGxla3QtcG9weXRhbHN5YS12eWJyYXQtc2xlZHV5dXNjaGVnby10cmVuZXJhLWRseWEtZGluYW1vLWNodG8taXotZXRvZ28tdnlzaGxv0gEA?hl=ru&gl=UA&ceid=UA%3Aru

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals

### Add your comment and screenshots

      `https://www.dynamomania.com/ru/news/678965-iskusstvennyj-intellekt-popytalsya-vybrat-sleduyuschego-trenera-dlya-dinamo-chto-iz-etogo-vyshlo`,           ,        , !

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
It looks like that they changed something (not the first time), I have fixed it again (filters update should be available in 1-2 hours).
If you don't want to wait for filters update, you can add this rule:
```adblock
now.gg#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'pagead2.googlesyndication.com')
```
to user rules.

issue.title: go.redirectingat.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

-

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

-

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

`https://www.pcworld.com/article/394953/why-does-the-steam-deck-run-linux-blame-windows.html`

There are several links to `go.redirectingat.com` on that page (7 results with `##a[href*="go.redirectingat.com"]`).

For example:
`https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=[Number]&url=https://www.protondb.com/&xcust=[Another_Number]&sref=https://www.pcworld.com/article/394953/why-does-the-steam-deck-run-linux-blame-windows.html`


I propose:
```adb
||go.redirectingat.com^$removeparam=~url
```
Or:
```adb
||go.redirectingat.com^$removeparam=id
||go.redirectingat.com^$removeparam=xcust
||go.redirectingat.com^$removeparam=sref
```

And the result is:
`https://go.redirectingat.com/?url=https://www.protondb.com/`

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@Alex-302 @AdamWr @BlazDT @zloyden @Sergey-Lyapin @jellizaveta @piquark6046
I totally agree with OP. IMO we should ignore these OCD reports for very small PH or leftover and add it to filters policy, the traffic should be just one measure. The more we address these sort of things, the higher likelihood of FPs - not to mention bloating filters.
